Posts.Title: Zometa cancelled due to low calcium. What to do? Nataliya2003

Posts.Content: Nataliya2003 wrote: My mom has been ill with bone mets since July 2012. She has had 2 fractures: hand and hip. The first one has been treated, but they can't operate on the second (afraid she will not survive surgery). Luckily, she responded to tamox and the mets stopped growing. From, the start of her treatment, we had an argument with doctors, in re using bisphosphonates. She only Zometa twice and every time her calcium dropped to dangerous levels. Every time, doctors managed to bring them up. However, they are now refusing to continue with Zometa at all. Their arguments: she doesn't need it to decrease her calcium; even if they correct the calcium afterwards, this kind of "shocks" can cause a heart attack and kill her; the hormonal therapy is more important. I cannot agree with this. Zometa does a lot more than lower calcium, it decreases bone resorption and delays fractures. Any new fracture can kill mom. I don't know if they are right about it all. Mom really appears very fragile and she had heart problems before. But, we don't want to give up. What are the possible alternatives to bisphosphonates that can prevent fractures and treat her lytic lesions? Possibly, even vitamins or food supplements are better than nothing. Do you think Zometa is worth the risk? On Novartis website, they say Zometa is not an anti-cancer medicine. Thank you. Nataliya Log in to post a reply

Posts.Content: Nataliya2003 wrote: Hi ladies I've written about my mom before. She has extensive bone mets and had 2 fractures. Recently, her state has improved miraculously. However, they have completely ruled out a surgery on her femoral neck. They has been unable to stand for months due to the problem there. I am really scared how immobility will influence her general state of health. I am also afraid of such a long surgery, but being able to move more will improve her chnaces in the long term. Is there anyone who did hip replacement surgery at this age with numerous bone mets?
